    • Field Detail

      • NOVELTY_HORIZON

        public volatile int NOVELTY_HORIZON
        what this value represents was originally equal to the termlink record length (10), but we may want to adjust it or make it scaled according to duration since it has more to do with time than # of records. it can probably be increased several times larger since each item should remain in the recording queue for longer than 1 cycle

      • DECISION_THRESHOLD

        public volatile float DECISION_THRESHOLD
        Minimum expectation for a desire value to execute an operation. the range of "now" is [-DURATION, DURATION];

      • CONCEPT_BAG_SIZE

        public int CONCEPT_BAG_SIZE
        Size of ConceptBag and level amount

      • CONCEPT_BAG_LEVELS

        public int CONCEPT_BAG_LEVELS

      • DURATION

        public volatile int DURATION
        Cycles per duration. Past/future tense usage convention; How far away "past" and "future" is from "now", in cycles. The range of "now" is [-DURATION/2, +DURATION/2];

      • HORIZON

        public float HORIZON
        Evidential Horizon, the amount of future evidence to be considered. Must be >=1.0, usually 1 .. 2, not changeable at runtime as evidence measurement would change

      • TRUTH_EPSILON

        public float TRUTH_EPSILON
        determines the internal precision used for TruthValue calculations. a value of 0.01 gives 100 truth value states between 0 and 1.0. other values may be used, for example, 0.02 for 50, 0.10 for 10, etc. Change at your own risk, but can't be changed at runtime

      • BUDGET_EPSILON

        public float BUDGET_EPSILON

      • BUDGET_THRESHOLD

        public volatile float BUDGET_THRESHOLD
        The budget threshold rate for task to be accepted.

      • CONCEPT_FORGET_DURATIONS

        public volatile float CONCEPT_FORGET_DURATIONS
        Concept decay rate in ConceptBag, in [1, 99]. originally: CONCEPT_FORGETTING_CYCLE How many cycles it takes an item to decay completely to a threshold value (ex: 0.1). Lower means faster rate of decay.

      • TERMLINK_FORGET_DURATIONS

        public volatile float TERMLINK_FORGET_DURATIONS
        TermLink decay rate in TermLinkBag, in [1, 99]. originally: TERM_LINK_FORGETTING_CYCLE

      • TASKLINK_FORGET_DURATIONS

        public volatile float TASKLINK_FORGET_DURATIONS
        TaskLink decay rate in TaskLinkBag, in [1, 99]. originally: TASK_LINK_FORGETTING_CYCLE

      • EVENT_FORGET_DURATIONS

        public volatile float EVENT_FORGET_DURATIONS
        Sequence bag forget durations

        Maximum attempted combinations in variable introduction.
